results.title: Super 8 soldiers
results.creator_credit: Mark Worth, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Kino Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: This unusual video explores the day-to-day life of Australian soldiers who served during the Vietnamese War. By using super-8 film footage that the soldiers took of themselves, we are taken from training in Australia to the camps in Vietnam where the young men were to confront the terrors of fighting a bitter guerrila war. The super-8 images are ultimately touching because they reveal young boys at the point of losing their innocence. The haunting musical score is by David Bridie and John Phillips of Not Drowning, Waving.

results.title: Sunshine romance
results.brief_description: This short romantic docudrama was made in the year after World War II and begins by showing troops returning home and what “freedom” means to them and the women waiting for them after the horrors of war. A nationalistic film, with commentary about the future Bill and his girl Sue had planned before Bill was called off to war - symbolic of a nation with a great future. Set in the scenic beauty of the Blue Mountains and the colorful hustle bustle of Sydney. Featuring John Temple and Coralie Kelly as the lovers, and commentary by Robert Pollard.

results.title: Sunny Iceland: land of the vikings
results.brief_description: Shows the life of the people of barren but surprisingly warm Iceland: the green-houses which use hot springs; and the major industries, fishing and whaling.

results.title: Sunfruit
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Jackson Wain
results.brief_description: Records a visit by a school group to a pineapple farm in Queensland. Shows the harvesting and processing of pineapples, and provides information about the planting and development of the fruit. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Sundaze
results.creator_credit: Michael D. Carter and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: A simple animated film of Anne Graham’s line drawings of a sunny day at the beach. Illustrates the variety of occupations people follow on the beach, and implies that a summer day by the sea is one of the best ways of enjoying life. Dis-orienting use of sound lends further interest to this unconventional sociological survey.

results.title: Sunday by the sea
results.creator_credit: Anthony Simmons, Leon Clore and Harlequin Productions
results.brief_description: Watching a typical day at the Brighton seaside, we see how the Londoner enjoys himself on one of his favourite excursions. Ballads made famous in music halls take the place of commentary. Photography by Walter Lassally. (Awards: Grand Prix, Venice)

results.title: Sun Kosi: river of gold
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: Documents the progress of the 1981 Australian Himalayan Kayak Expedition down the 340 kilometre Sun Kosi River of Nepal. The first attempt to paddle the river, the trip combined danger and discovery as the men tackled the treacherous elements in a land untouched by the pressures of the Western world. Suitable for lower and middle secondary level.
